author: Justin Sink
description: The Senate Banking Committee is preparing to hold a hearing next week on the nomination of White House economic adviser Stephen Miran to serve as a Federal Reserve governor, as President Donald Trump accelerates his push to reshape the central bank.
title: Senate Panel Prepares to Hold Hearing on Trump’s Fed Pick

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Trump administration said it has asked the US Supreme Court to let officials block billions of dollars in foreign assistance funds approved by Congress for the year.
title: Trump DOJ Asks Supreme Court to Approve Foreign Aid Freeze

author: Daniela Sirtori
description: Cracker Barrel Old Country Store Inc. said it’s getting rid of a new logo that had sparked controversy and prompted a slump in its share price.
title: Cracker Barrel Scraps New Logo After Social Media Backlash

author: Fabiola Zerpa
description: Venezuela will deploy vessels to a key oil-exporting hub near Colombia in response to the US’s decision to send warships to the southern Caribbean.
title: Venezuela to Deploy Ships to Oil Exporting Hub After US Move

author: Allyson Versprille
description: US Federal Aviation Administration staff working at the agency’s current headquarters in Washington will be relocated to a newer facility already in use by the Department of Transportation, Secretary Sean Duffy said in a message to employees Tuesday.
title: FAA Headquarters Staff to Move to DC’s Navy Yard, Duffy Says

author: Sarah Holder, Rachael Lewis-Krisky
description: On today’s Big Take Podcast: What Trump’s push to oust Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook says about his plans for the central bank.
title: Trump Moves to Fire Lisa Cook, Sparking Legal Fight and Concerns About Fed Independence

author: Erik Larson, Patricia Hurtado
description: President Donald Trump is challenging a New York appeals court decision holding him liable for fraud in a state lawsuit over his asset valuations, seeking to fully clear his name even after his nearly half-billion penalty in the case was tossed out.
title: Trump Appeals NY Court Ruling That He Called a ‘Total Victory’

author: Yang Yang, K Oanh Ha
description: On today’s Big Take Asia podcast, we look at South Korea’s booming shipbuilding industry and how the nation has teamed up with the US to counter China’s dominance.
title: Trump Has a Shipbuilding Dream. Can South Korea Make It a Reality?

author: Adrian Leung, Josh Xiao, Jing Li, Christopher Udemans, Daniel Ten Kate
description: For the full experience visit: Xi Unleashes China’s Biggest Purge of Military Leaders Since Mao
title: Xi Unleashes China’s Biggest Purge of Military Leaders Since Mao

author: Erik Larson
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, legal affairs reporter Erik Larson looks at the coming court battle over the Federal Reserve. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump’s Bid to Oust Fed’s Cook May Turn on Definition of ‘Cause’

author: Michael MacKenzie, Greg Ritchie, Carter Johnson
description: President Donald Trump’s unprecedented and escalating attack on the Federal Reserve runs the risk of backfiring by hitting financial markets and the economy with higher long-term borrowing costs.
title: Trump’s Fed Gamble Risks Pushing Key Bond Rates Even Higher

author: Saleha Mohsin
description: The Trump administration is reviewing options for exerting more influence over the Federal Reserve’s 12 regional banks that would potentially extend its reach beyond personnel appointments in Washington, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump Team Weighing Options to Extend Influence to Fed Banks

author: Alan Katz
description: Emmanuel Macron pushed back on Tuesday against claims by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the French president was abetting antisemitism by planning to recognize a Palestinian state.
title: Macron and Netanyahu Spar Over France’s Push for Palestinian Statehood

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Annmarie Hordern
description: US President Donald Trump warned of “an economic war” if he cannot get Russia’s Vladimir Putin and Ukraine’s Volodymyr Zelenskiy to end their conflict, saying he had “very serious” consequences in mind if the fighting continues.
title: Trump Warns of ‘Economic War’ If Putin Doesn’t Pursue Peace

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump wished pop singer Taylor Swift and professional football player Travis Kelce “a lot of luck” on their newly announced engagement.
title: Trump Wishes Swift, Kelce ‘A Lot of Luck’ on Engagement

author: Annmarie Hordern, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said he was prepared for a legal fight with Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook after he moved to oust her from her post following allegations that she falsified mortgage documents.
title: Trump Says He’s Prepared for Fight Over Cook’s Ouster From Fed

author: Georgia Hall, Nacha Cattan
description: New York Mayor Eric Adams said he has no plans to drop out of November’s election after his struggling campaign was rocked last week by more corruption allegations.
title: New York Mayor Adams Is Running for Reelection ‘No Matter What’

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Presidential candidate Jorge “Tuto” Quiroga intends to seek better terms on Bolivia’s $14 billion of overseas debt to stabilize an economy ravaged by shortages and soaring inflation.
title: Presidential Hopeful Vows to Negotiate Bolivia $14 Billion Debt

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Annmarie Hordern
description: President Donald Trump threatened that prosecutors would seek the death penalty for anyone found guilty of murder in Washington, DC, a move that would escalate his crime crackdown in the nation’s capital.
title: Trump Floats Death Penalty for All Convicted of Murder in DC

author: Kelcee Griffis
description: President Donald Trump on Aug. 24 suggested that the TV networks NBC and ABC should lose their permission to broadcast due to coverage that he says is unfair to him. It’s not the first time the president has made such an argument.
title: Can Trump Take ABC, NBC Off the Air? What to Know About US Broadcast Licenses

author: Erik Larson, Chris Dolmetsch
description: President Donald Trump has moved to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook after she refused his demand to resign over a claim by a top administration official that she lied on mortgage applications. The escalation sets the stage for a lawsuit that will help determine the extent of White House control over the US central bank.
title: Can Trump Really Fire Fed Governor Cook? Here’s What the Law Says

author: Catherine Lucey, Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump plans to name longtime aide Dan Scavino as the director of the White House personnel office, an influential role responsible for staffing positions throughout the administrations.
title: Trump to Name Loyalist Scavino as White House Personnel Chief

author: Peter Blumberg, Jamie Tarabay
description: President Donald Trump has repeatedly deployed the US military for domestic assignments. In June, he summoned the Guard and the Marines to Los Angeles — over the objections of local leaders — to subdue protests against his administration’s mass arrests of migrants. And in August, Trump called up the Guard to combat violent street crime in Washington, DC.
title: Why Trump’s Use of Military in US Is So Controversial

author: Melissa Shin
description: Canada’s efforts to reduce immigration levels mean the current pace of homebuilding is enough to alleviate a housing shortage and drive up the vacancy rate, the country’s budget watchdog predicted in a report.
title: Immigrants Curbs to Help Ease Canada’s Housing Shortage, Budget Watchdog Says

author: Katarina Hoije
description: Four people died in an attack by unidentified assailants in northern Ivory Coast, one of several coastal states facing a growing threat by militants in West Africa’s Sahel region.
title: Ivory Coast Attack Leaves Four Dead, Highlighting Growing Threat

author: Gregory Korte
description: President Donald Trump has escalated his years-long crusade against voting by mail, threatening action to restrict its use in federal elections nationwide. On Aug. 18, he wrote in a Truth Social post that “ELECTIONS CAN NEVER BE HONEST WITH MAIL IN BALLOTS/VOTING,” and promised to sign an executive order “to help bring HONESTY to the 2026 Midterm Elections.” There’s no evidence that mail-in ballots are used to commit voter fraud on a large scale in the US.
title: Why Trump Has a Problem With Mail-In Voting

author: Sharon Klyne
description: Australia’s corporate regulator said it will boost surveillance of private markets as it targets areas of financial services that present the greatest risks.
title: Australia Watchdog Says It Will Increase Private Market Scrutiny

author: Myriam Balezou, Levin Stamm
description: The Swiss economy ministry is seeking input from UBS Group AG as it scrambles to get an improved US trade deal, potentially providing the country’s largest lender an avenue for better ties with the government.
title: UBS Asked by Swiss Economy Ministry for Support on US Tariffs

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick suggested the government is looking at the defense sector and other industries for potential stakes in companies after an unorthodox deal that saw the US obtain a 10% share in chipmaker Intel Corp.
title: Lutnick Suggests US Looking at Defense Industry After Intel Deal

author: Jarrell Dillard, Annmarie Hordern
description: Former Federal Reserve Vice Chair Lael Brainard suggested there’s a real risk of multiple Fed district bank presidents getting removed from office next year as a result of politically charged maneuvering by President Donald Trump.
title: Fed Bank Presidents Face Risk of Removal on Trump’s Maneuvers, Brainard Says

author: Sri Taylor
description: California, New Mexico and Washington are at risk of losing a cumulative $46 million a year in federal trucking safety funds after the Trump administration accused the states of flouting English-language rules for commercial drivers.
title: Trump Threatens to Pull State Funds Over English Language Rule

author: Anusha Attygalle, Asantha Sirimanne
description: Sri Lanka’s former President Ranil Wickremesinghe was released on bail after being held in custody since Aug. 22 on allegations he misused government funds while head of state in 2023.
title: Sri Lanka Ex-President Gets Bail After Arrest on Misuse of Funds

author: Suzanne Lynch, Andrea Palasciano
description: The European Union lashed out at claims that its digital regulations are unfair, a day after US President Donald Trump threated to impose tariffs on countries that have digital services taxes.
title: EU Defends Right to Regulate After Trump Attacks Digital Taxes

author: Ott Tammik
description: An armed drone which crashed in Estonia is likely to be a Ukrainian drone that veered off-course due to Russia’s electronic interference in the Baltic region, officials in Tallinn said.
title: Estonia Blames Russian Jamming for Explosion of Ukrainian Drone

author: Tom Rees
description: Academic research that is vital for UK policy making is being undermined by a deepening crisis in the country’s official indicators, the body for British economists warned, as it called for “urgent remedial action” to fix the problem.
title: UK Data Crisis Hits Research Vital for Policy, Academics Warn

author: Gresa Kraja
description: Kosovo’s parliament elected a speaker, ending a political stalemate that paralyzed decision-making and prevented the formation of a new government six months after the country’s election.
title: Kosovo Elects New Speaker, Ending Six-Month Political Deadlock

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canada is set to begin discussions on supplying liquefied natural gas to German buyers to tap into growing demand across the European Union.
title: Canada to Launch Talks on Shipping LNG to German Customers

author: Alex Morales
description: Nigel Farage vowed to expel tens of thousands of asylum-seekers from the UK, tapping a policy deployed in the US by President Donald Trump as he seeks to guide his populist Reform party to power at the next general election.
title: Farage Embraces Trump-Style Deportation Agenda in Bid to Lead UK

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India expects its indigenously-built missile shield to be operational within a decade, defense chief Anil Chauhan said.
title: India Plans Homegrown Missile Shield by 2035, Top General Says

author: Sara Sjolin
description: Trump has halted the US wind-farm project by Danish developer Orsted
title: Trump Politics and Denmark’s Green Credentials Collide

author: Dan Williams, Fares Alghoul
description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will convene Israel’s top decision-making forum on Tuesday to discuss prospects for a deal to wind down the almost two-year-old war in Gaza, while the army prepares for a final push into the Palestinian territory’s biggest city.
title: Israel Seeks Truce on Its Terms as Army Edges Into Gaza City

author: William Horobin
description: Opposition to French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s government gained momentum on Tuesday, adding to the likelihood that it could be forced out as soon as next month.
title: French Premier Risks Government Collapse as Opposition Grows

author: Manuela Tobias
description: For decades, yerba mate farmers benefited from state intervention. But now under a libertarian president many growers are struggling to survive.
title: Messi’s Favorite Drink Is Rocked After Milei Ends Price Controls

author: Mpho Hlakudi
description: Emerging-market stocks and currencies lost ground Tuesday as traders turned risk-off after US President Donald Trump increased pressure on the Federal Reserve and rekindled global trade tensions.
title: Emerging-Market Assets Drop as Trade, Fed Tensions Hit Sentiment

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuanian lawmakers approved Social Democrat Inga Ruginiene as the Baltic nation’s next prime minister, giving her the mandate to form a new government and turn the page on a business scandal that fractured the ruling coalition.
title: Lithuanian Lawmakers Back Former Trade Union Leader as Premier

author: Tasos Vossos
description: French companies with limited exposure to the domestic economy are looking to raise new funds in the bond market just as the country’s political risk is heating up.
title: French Firms Test Demand From Credit Buyers Amid Political Risk

author: Levin Stamm
description: Switzerland’s manufacturing sector is mired in a recession that’s likely to get worse because of the 39% tariffs the US unexpectedly imposed on the country.
title: Swiss Manufacturers See US Tariffs Worsening a ‘Downward Spiral’

author: Laura Dhillon Kane, Kamil Kowalcze
description: Germany and Canada vowed to expand cooperation on securing supply chains for the critical minerals that are key to energy and defense technologies.
title: Merz and Carney Pledge Deeper Collaboration on Critical Minerals

author: Takashi Umekawa
description: Japan’s Ministry of Finance made an initial request of ¥32.4 trillion ($219 billion) for next fiscal year’s debt financing needs, reflecting the impact from rising Japanese bond yields.
title: Japan’s Finance Ministry Seeks Record Budget for Debt Financing

author: Sagarika Jaisinghani, Julien Ponthus
description: French stocks fell on Tuesday as political uncertainty ratcheted up following Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s plan to call a confidence vote.
title: French Stocks Drive Declines in Europe on Confidence Vote Plan

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth
description: Norway’s $2 trillion sovereign wealth fund excluded heavy-equipment maker Caterpillar Inc. based on Israel’s use of its bulldozers to destroy Palestinian property in Gaza and the West Bank.
title: Norway Wealth Fund Blacklists Caterpillar Over West Bank Links

author: Lucy White
description: Concerns around wealth taxes are prompting worries that the UK’s ultra rich are moving abroad, but the business of managing their fortunes is still largely staying in London, new data show.
title: UK’s Rich Are Keeping Family Offices in London Despite Tax Worry

author: David Goodman
description: French assets sold off for a second day as Prime Minister Francois Bayrou’s decision to call a confidence vote in his own government continued to ripple through markets.
title: French Assets Fall for a Second Day as Political Concerns Mount

description: Just a few hours before South Korean President Lee Jae Myung was set to enter the White House, a social media post from the US leader threatened to derail the summit.
title: Trump’s Book Helped South Korea’s Lee Avoid a ‘Zelenskiy Moment’

author: Rakesh Sharma, Yongchang Chin
description: Refiners in India, among the largest buyers of Russian crude, are planning to trim their purchases in the coming weeks, a modest concession to Washington’s hawks less than a day ahead of a hike in US tariffs, but also a signal that the country has no plans to sever ties with Moscow.
title: India to Ease Russian Oil Purchases as Higher US Levies Loom

author: John Liu, Jing Li
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Chinese leader Xi Jinping sent him a note of congratulation on the 34th anniversary of the country’s independence, days before Russian President Vladimir Putin is scheduled to visit China.
title: Zelenskiy Says Xi Sent Independence Day Message to Ukraine

author: Ruchi Bhatia, Shruti Srivastava
description: When Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi stood on the ramparts of the 17th century Red Fort in New Delhi and announced a cut to consumption taxes, he took many of his own officials by surprise.
title: Modi Is Seizing on Trump’s Tariffs to Cut India Taxes, Red Tape

author: Swati Pandey
description: The US, UK and Australia’s trilateral partnership is at an “inflection point,” and all three must redouble efforts to ensure its success, a Washington-based think tank said.
title: US, UK, Australia Partnership at ‘Inflection Point,’ CSIS Says

author: Laura Dhillon Kane
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is set to visit Germany’s Thyssenkrupp Marine Systems, one of the key bidders for a multibillion-dollar submarine contract, as his government ramps up defense spending.
title: Carney Visits Germany’s TKMS as Canada Looks to Spend Billions on Subs

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia has uncovered credible evidence that Iran was behind a number of antisemitic attacks and has expelled the Iranian ambassador in response, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said.
title: Australia Finds Iran Behind Antisemitic Attacks, Expels Envoy

author: Catarina Saraiva
description: President Donald Trump late Monday said he would fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook for alleged mortgage fraud.
title: Who is Lisa Cook, the Fed Governor Trump Is Trying to Fire?

author: Josh Xiao, Jon Herskovitz
description: China is preparing to showcase its latest anti-ship missiles, combat drones and nuclear-capable ballistic missiles in a parade aimed at demonstrating its military prowess — and perhaps attracting potential buyers.
title: Satellite Images Show China Parade Weapons Capable of US Strikes

author: Philip Glamann
description: China is sending a key trade negotiator to the US this week, the Wall Street Journal reported — indicating talks between the two sides are resuming after they agreed on a truce in their dispute.
title: China Dispatching Senior Trade Negotiator to the US, WSJ Says

author: Neil Jerome Morales
description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. has relieved the police chief from his post, less than three months since being promoted to the job.
title: Philippines’ Marcos Removes Police Chief Who Led Duterte Arrest

author: Soo-Hyang Choi
description: President Donald Trump said he would like to meet North Korean leader Kim Jong Un this year as South Korea floated the idea of constructing a Trump Tower in the reclusive country if diplomatic relations improve.
title: Trump Says He Wants to Meet North Korea’s Kim Jong Un This Year

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, William Horobin
description: US President Donald Trump threatened to impose fresh tariffs and export restrictions on advanced technology and semiconductors in retaliation against other nations’ digital services taxes that hit American technology companies.
title: Trump Vows Export Curbs, Tariffs in Digital Tax Reprisal

author: Colum Murphy, Martin Ritchie
description: President Donald Trump said the US has more leverage over China on trade than the other way around, citing airplane parts as a key item Washington has to counter Beijing’s restrictions on rare earths.
title: Trump Says US Has Much Bigger Leverage Over China on Magnets

author: Jonnelle Marte
description: President Donald Trump moved to remove Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook from her post at the US central bank in the wake of allegations that she falsified documents on mortgage applications.
title: Trump Removes Fed Governor Lisa Cook Effective Immediately
